Paragraph: 11 However , despite these numerous attractive properties of NDT - based polymer semiconductors , their limited solubility in organic solvents has hindered their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| NDT-based polymer semiconductors |

Note: I assumed that "NDT" in "NDT-based polymer semiconductors" is a short form for a material name, as it is not defined in the paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 11 However , despite these numerous attractive properties of NDT - based polymer semiconductors , their limited solubility in organic solvents has hindered their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| limited solubility |

The paragraph mentions one "Property Name" entity, which is "limited solubility". This refers to the property of NDT-based polymer semiconductors that makes them difficult to dissolve in organic solvents, thereby hindering their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| limited solubility |

The paragraph mentions one "Property Name" entity, which is "limited solubility". This refers to the property of NDT-based polymer semiconductors that makes them difficult to dissolve in organic solvents, thereby hindering their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics.

I have removed the entity "numerous attractive properties" since it is not a specific material property but a general term referring to various desirable characteristics of NDT-based polymer semiconductors.
